article.headline: Campbell 79, Belmont 67
article.story: BUIES CREEK, N.C. (AP) -- Russ Gibson led five Campbell players in double figures as the Camels beat Belmont 79-67 on Thursday night. The win broke Campbell's 12-game losing streak against their Atlantic Sun Conference rival. Gibson scored a game-high 19 points, while Ledell Eackles added 15 points and five steals. Campbell (8-9, 3-4 Atlantic Sun) broke open a double-digit lead in the opening eight minutes and held a comfortable margin throughout the game, taking a 38-27 lead at halftime. Belmont (12-7, 6-2) put on an early second half run, but was never able to get closer than six points from Campbell. The Bruins shot 43 percent for the game and gave up 21 turnovers. Justin Hare led Belmont with 15 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
